    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The clash between Manchester City and Leicester at the Etihad Stadium was a thrilling encounter, characterized by its intensity, numerous chances, and occasional moments of brilliance. The match ended 2-1 in favor of Manchester City, whose efficiency in the final third proved decisive in clinching victory, though Leicester gave them a tough fight throughout.

### First Half:

#### Kick-Off and Initial Exchanges
The game kicked off with Leicester taking control right from the outset. However, the ball quickly went out of play, resulting in a Leicester throw-in in the opening minute. The initial minutes saw both teams struggling to establish control, resulting in frequent turnovers and clearances. Leicester managed an early shot on target within the first five minutes, showcasing their intent to challenge City.

#### Early Chances and Manchester City Pressure
City responded swiftly, with Leroy Sane and David Silva becoming resourceful. By the third minute, a corner had been earned by Manchester City, quickly followed by a shot which went off-target. Leicester's defense was alert, clearing subsequent threats from City. The game then entered a phase marked by quick transitions as both teams vied for possession and position. 

A period of constant pressure from Manchester City led to numerous corners — one after the other. Gael Clichy's fine lofted pass into the box was met with a defensive clearance, other corners followed but Leicester's defense was continually well-organized. Kevin De Bruyne's monstrous shot in the 24th minute, which could have put City ahead, hit a defender, and thus, went out for another corner. Through these exchanges, City illustrated their continuous threat from set-pieces and open play.

#### Goals Exchange and Key Moments
A breakthrough finally came in the 29th minute when Leroy Sane's great pass found David Silva inside the Leicester penalty area. Silva made no mistake and rifled his shot into the bottom right corner to give City a 1-0 lead. Jubilant from the goal, City continued to press aggressively. Moments after their opening goal, they earned a penalty in the 34th minute when Yohan Benalouane from Leicester fouled and was subsequently yellow-carded. Gabriel Jesus stepped up to take the penalty and delivered with a low drive into the left side of the net, making it 2-0 in favor of Manchester City.

Yet, Leicester was quick to respond. In the 41st minute, Shinji Okazaki unleashed a brilliant strike from outside the box. Wilfredo Caballero stretched but could not reach, and the ball ended in the roof of City’s net, reducing the deficit to 2-1. Leicester’s goal marked an essential response and kept them within touching distance heading into the break.

#### Interruption and Injuries
But before the end of the first half, several interruptions and a heated tussle marked proceedings. Marc Albrighton needed medical attention at one point but was able to continue playing. As the clock ticked towards halftime, some late shots on target from both sides were seen, but none altered the scoreline. With a whistle from the referee, the first half concluded with Manchester City leading 2-1.

### Second Half:

#### Kick-Off and Continuous Attacks
The second half started with Manchester City kicking off and trying to build on their momentum. Leicester tried to claw their way back early on but were met with solid defensive work from the City backline. Within a minute, Marc Albrighton took a shot from the edge of the box, only to see it fly well wide of the post.

#### Fouls and Set-Pieces
The early stages of the second half were littered with fouls, indirect free-kicks, and a significant number of throw-ins by both teams as they remained vigilant not to concede early in the period. Vincent Kompany found himself with a booking in the 5th minute for a thoughtless challenge.

#### Persistent Leicester Efforts
Leicester kept pressing, trying to equalize. From indirect free-kicks to corner kicks, they created several opportunities but failed to capitalize. By mid-period, Leicester substituted Andy King, who couldn’t continue due to an injury, bringing on Daniel Amartey.

#### Critical Miss by Mahrez
One of the most dramatic moments came when Leicester was awarded a penalty following a foul inside the box by Gael Clichy of Manchester City. Riyad Mahrez stepped up to take the spot-kick. Unfortunately for Leicester, Mahrez, trying to deceive the keeper, slipped during the penalty execution, ultimately resulting in a failed penalty as the referee called a foul due to Mahrez’s double contact with the ball. This missed opportunity was pivotal, leaving Leicester trailing by one goal.

#### Strategic Substitutions and Defending Lead
In response, Pep Guardiola made strategic substitutions by bringing on fresh legs including Sergio Aguero and later Jesus Navas. It was clear City was aiming to solidify their lead — managing the game through possession and careful play. Several yellow cards were issued to both teams throughout this half, demonstrating the high stakes and physical nature of the battle.

David Silva had a close chance when he collected a pass on the edge of the box but saw his shot brilliantly blocked by the Leicester defense. As both teams battled, Leicester continued to press but were often hindered by timely interceptions and clearances by City’s defense.

### Closing Moments
In the closing stages, Leicester attempted a few more shots on target but couldn’t break through Manchester City’s robust defensive setup. Noteworthy was the attendance figure at the Etihad Stadium — 54,407 fans witnessed the engrossing encounter. Both teams continued to exchange possession and fouls till the end. Leicester had a last chance from a free-kick which ended up with Mahrez’s attempt being comfortably saved by Caballero.

#### Full-Time Whistle
After several injury stoppages and substitutions, the referee finally blew the whistle, ending the match at 90+ minutes. The home side, Manchester City, emerged victorious with a 2-1 scoreline. Leicester City, despite a brave fight and moments of promising play, left with nothing from this tough match.

### Concluding Remarks
Manchester City’s efficiency, particularly with their set-pieces and taking advantage of defensive errors by Leicester, made the difference. Leicester exhibited resilience and had their moments, most notably the stunning strike from Shinji Okazaki. But, their missed penalty alongside failing to capitalize on some key attacks left them falling short.

The technical expertise demonstrated by both the managers in substitutions and tactical shifts added layers of intrigue to the match. The game, though riddled with fouls and cards, was a display of determination and high footballing spirits from both teams. Manchester City, with this win, reinforced their strong standing, while Leicester had lessons to learn ahead of their next fixtures.
